title: The demographic shifts in voting, visualized
description: A look at how the votes of Americans have changed since 2016.

title: Proud Boys member who led Jan. 6 charge at Capitol sentenced to 5 years
description: Daniel "Milkshake" Scott shouted about taking the Capitol hours before the breach and led an assault that broke a key police line.

title: DOJ will no longer intervene on behalf of Trump in Carroll defamation suit
description: The Justice Department had argued that Trump was immune from any liability because he was acting within his presidential duties when he denied sexually assaulting E. Jean Carroll.

title: ‘Insane,’ ‘ludicrous,’ ‘absurd’: FBI’s Wray shows teeth to GOP critics
description: The FBI director played up his status as a Republican while showing his critics some teeth.

title: PGA hearing spotlights helpless attitude toward sportswashing, Saudis
description: Defense of the PGA's partnership with LIV Golf aligns with the long-standing American trend of bowing to Saudi power.

title: The GOP’s march away from Ukraine has halted
description: Many Republicans remain skeptical of funding for Ukraine. But the party's move away from support largely ceased earlier this year, with indications that some support might even have been restored.

title: ‘Insane,’ ‘ludicrous,’ ‘absurd’: FBI’s Wray shows teeth to GOP critics
description: The FBI director played up his status as a Republican while showing his critics some teeth.

title: Congress struggles to see expanding foreign funding of U.S. sports
description: After Tuesday's Senate hearing on a massive Saudi-funded golf deal, Republicans and Democrats fail to recognize how much Middle Eastern sovereign wealth funds are pouring into sports.

title: FBI chief Chris Wray: ‘Insane’ to say I’m biased against conservatives
description: Wray appears before Congress for the first time since the June indictment of Donald Trump and plea agreement with Hunter Biden.

title: Study finds GOP midterm wins came down to partisan turnout, not defections
description: A Pew survey finds Trump voters were more likely than Biden voters to turn out last fall

title: No Labels snags Sen. Joe Manchin for event, stoking talk of presidential run
description: Sen. Joe Manchin III (D-W.Va.) is slated to appear next week at an event hosted by the bipartisan group No Labels. Manchin has not ruled out a third-party presidential bid.

title: Murdoch is realizing that he’s stuck with the monster he created
description: Multiple reports suggest that Rupert Murdoch — and by extension his media empire — is giving up hope on Ron DeSantis. He can largely blame himself.

title: Biden, G-7 leaders announce major security assurance pact for Ukraine
description: NATO promises Ukraine support that is short of what Zelensky wanted, but is aimed at preventing future attacks on his country

title: PGA hearing spotlights helpless attitude toward sportswashing, Saudis
description: Defense of the PGA's partnership with LIV Golf aligns with the long-standing American trend of bowing to Saudi power.

title: Southern border ‘eerily quiet’ after policy shift on asylum seekers
description: The Biden administration is allowing tens of thousands of migrants to enter the United States legally each month, while those who don’t follow the rules face ramped-up deportations.

title: Teens buying ghost guns online, with deadly consequences
description: Dozens of teens have bought, built and shot ghost guns in recent years, and a federal attempt to regulate sales has faltered.

title: Republicans plan efforts to tout early voting tactics they once vilified
description: Some GOP critics worry about infighting and a lack of experience among new groups that are organizing to encourage voting before Election Day

title: States where abortion is legal, banned or under threat
description: More than a dozen states have laws that criminalize abortion when the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade. Here’s a look at abortion laws by state.

title: Judge orders former Trump aide Bannon to pay lawyers nearly $500,000
description: A judge orders former Trump aide Steve Bannon to pay his former lawyers for past legal work, including assisting him in obtaining a pardon.

title: GOP candidates scramble to attract donors to qualify for first debate
description: Republican presidential candidates are resorting to unique — and eyebrow-raising — incentives to build grassroots support and break through a crowded field.

title: Republicans say they would like to call witness despite criminal indictment
description: Republicans spent weeks defending Gal Luft as a valuable informant to possible ethical misdeeds by the Biden family. Now he's been indicted for alleged crimes related to China and Iran.

title: Former lawmakers plan new group to stop No Labels presidential bid
description: The bipartisan effort is aimed at stopping a third-party effort that many Democrats fear would hurt Biden and help Trump.

title: The latest on Donald Trump’s indictments and other key investigations
description: What to know about Donald Trump's indictments in Miami and New York, and other investigations of the former president.
